Reviews.Title: “One night in Mayaguez, PR”
Reviews.Author: NavyAllan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an older Holiday Inn but is well maintained. The room was clean and quite except for the AC unit. It was noisy. We upgraded to an Executive room and it was worth the money but still was small. The front desk staff was polite and effective. Good hotel and grounds security. The only thing that should be added to enhance security is an in-room safe. I have stayed at all the chain hotels in Mayaguez PR and this is the best one for the value. We didnâ€™t eat in the restaurant and the casino was closed due to be Good Friday. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No credit for days not used, death in the family.”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl94
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to AÃ±asco to visit my Dad for years and we have stayed at this hotel many times with no problem. We went to visit my dad and had a reservation for 8 days, my dad had a stroke and he passed away Palm Sunday, we had a wake in AÃ±asco but my dad always wanted to be buried in Caguas where my mom is buried. When we informed the hotel we would not use the last 2 days of our reservation because we would be in the other side of the island, we were shocked to find out they do not reimburse you for the days not used, not even if there is a death in the family. Expedia would not fight our case for us, but they gave us a credit to use in any future travel. We are so disgusted with what happened to us, never again will we stay at this hotel when we go to visit our family. The hotel managers we spoke to were very rude even after knowing the situation we were in. If we wanted to cancel for any other reason I would not complain, but a death in the family? they have no shame.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM!!”
Reviews.Author: Profesora5
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the hotel room to sleep, but it was a fantastic experience. The room was great and the bathroom was extremely clean. The people was very friendly and informative. The breakfast buffet was delicious. I look forward to staying there again. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great check in experience”
Reviews.Author: Sandsculptureman
Reviews.Content: We had a two night reservation while traveling between Ponce and Isla Verdi. The desk clerk was very helpful. They had already upgraded us because of platnum priority clup status, but he went one step further and upgraded us again to a two room suite. Very nice. The room did have a slight musty odor to it. I have come to expect that in this climate. I think the hotels in this area exist for the sake of the casinos. I am not much of a gambler so we spent the afternoon getting to know the area. We traveled to Rincon beach, Rincon light house, and Sandy Beach. None of which were very impressive. In fact we decided that we were wasting vacation time on this end of the island. We decided to add a night to our next reservation at the Intercontinental, and leave Mayaguez early. I booked this hotel with points and thought I would rather loose them than the day wasted with little to do. I talked to the desk clerk and let them know that we would not need the room for the next night and they were very pleasant about it. They even suggested that if I called Priority Club that I might be able to get the points credited back to my account. I did call and it worked out fine. The points for the next night were credited back to my account. Overall the hotel is nice enough. If you are entertained by gambling this would be a good place to stay. If you like the beach, don't waste time with anything but the north east end of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable choice for the area”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: No sea-views from this hotel, but it's an OK choice for an overnight in Mayaguez. Also not near the center of town, but near the airport. Has a casino if that is any interest to you. It's an older property, but looks to have been kept updated. It was clean & acceptable. Nothing to be impressed with, but it should serve your needs, Don't expect a resort atmosphere, because that is NOT this hotel. Staff were courteous, polite & helpful. Did not try the restaurant, & the only bar is inside the casino (Fat Tuesdays chain).

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the best Holiday Inns out there.”
Reviews.Author: BoricuaLaw
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Holiday Inn located in Ponce many times and it is great. However, this one in Mayaguez is not one of their best locations. The rooms are very clean, but they need some renovation. The rooms are NOT worth the $140 we payed for the night. Our room did not even had a safe, which is standard in every hotel. I would not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to sleep at west side of Island”
Reviews.Author: mcasiano
Reviews.Content: No matter what trip, family, business, romance, I always find this hotel a great place. The room is excellent, they have king and double rooms with lcd tvs, big bathrooms, great a/c, clean carpets. Its a great place, about the pool, its a little one, no view to beach or any interesting. If you stay a Friday or Saturday, please get in before 6pm or you will have to return after 11pm (parking its a small one), there's a Casino on 1st floor and I think all people in town go there on weekends. I stayed there two times on Thanksgiving weekend, one business trip and about three times on Christmas season. Great service, front desk, restaurant, great breakfast either buffet or 'a la carta'. They have a mini disco bar, great for a beer or some exotic drink, great music system (too loud for me). I can recommend this place over other hotels in the area. Another thing, there's a gas station about 5 minutes from there in car with pizza, chicken, hot dogs and all type of snacks.

Reviews.Title: “This was bad...”
Reviews.Author: ocean35
Reviews.Content: Loud casino, no store, smelly everything. The room was terrible, there had to be mold in the carpet. The a-c is an antique. Stay somewhere else if there is an alternative (not sure).

Reviews.Title: “Bad humor and service”
Reviews.Author: tattoolawyer
Reviews.Content: Parking! Can you believe guest reserved parking is more than 200 meters away? Hotel employees have bad humor and bad service!

Reviews.Title: “Room could have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: kittytexas2011
Reviews.Content: Our room was infested with ants along the wall and desk! housekeeping was called only for them to come spray "Raid" the smell was horrible, we requested another room and ended up in a Smokers Room (only room available) had no choice but to keep the room. We were given a ticket for Free Breakfast for the inconvenience but found out when we got back home that our credit card had a charge against it for the Breakfast! Called hotel back to inquire and I kept getting transferred around! the lady in accounts payable was rude and didnt seem to care about the charge! I called headquarters to report the charge to my card. Will never come back to this Holiday Inn Again! Hopefully I will receive my charge to my credit card back?

Reviews.Title: “Make Sure You Stay on the Right Side of the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ol9382
Reviews.Content: There are not many hotel options in this part of Puerto Rico. When choosing this hotel make sure that you have a room not facing the main street. This was one of the noisiest hotels we have been in so far. Apart from the noise, the hotel is satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable service and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: WorldWonderer77
Reviews.Content: They offer feather pillows!! Never had that lucky luck before. Asked for one and they brought me two. Gave us free tickets to the Mayaguez Zoo which, by the way, is something everyone MUST see. Room clean. Staff super friendly and helpful. No room frig but they will bring you one for an additional $5 a day. Casino on site. Nice continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay minus the Chickens”
Reviews.Author: Samurai_Dog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn because it was recommended to us by our friends. We drove from San Juan to Mayaguez. The pool area was large and pretty (minus the chickens). Overall we had a nice, but short stay at the Holiday Inn. Pros: **Casino, Bar, Restaurant, Computers with internet access on second floor, and pretty pool area **Because of the casino there was extra security in the hotel and parking lot so we always felt safe, even when returning late at night. **The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. **We ate at the restaurant for dinner and had a good meal. I had coconut crusted shrimp with plantains and it was delicious. **We both got a free drink ticket when we checked in so we went to the bar on site (Fat Tuesday's) and I had a frozen pina colada and my husband had a beer. **There are lots of stores and restaurants nearby. **There was a large pool area with lounge chairs, pretty palm trees, and a basketball area. A hotel employee worked a towel area. You had to check out and return towels to him. Cons: **There were chickens in the parking lot and pool area. I am scared of birds and chickens so I did not like sitting poolside while chickens walked around. I could see them jump the fence from the neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: swtexan
Reviews.Content: We were road weary and did not get to the Hotel until after dark but what we found was suprising. The front desk was very helpful and kind, just as everyone else in Puerto Rico. When we got to the room we found a nice, clean, newly up dated room with the most comfortable bed I found in Puerto Rico. The AC was a little weak and not the best but everything else made up for it. Another post mentioned a strong odor of cleaning supplies and I must say that I did smell some but it was nothing that bothered me at all. There was a good size bathroom, a casino and cafe. I would stay here anytime I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Smell Like Detergent”
Reviews.Author: Nikita141
Reviews.Content: All the rooms have an overpowering smell of detergent because the A/C unit leaks water into the carpet of the rooms. There's mold and stagnant water in the carpet so everyday they "deep clean" each room with strong detergents to mask the smell of stagnant water. I slept horribly because the smell of detergent kept burning my nose. I say "rooms" because we moved rooms twice until I finally gave up realizing all the rooms have this problem. I wouldn't even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “If your unsure, I highly recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SammyWillow
Reviews.Content: First time to Puerto Rico to go scuba diving in Boqueron (Cabo Rojo area). Stayed in Mayaguez at the Holiday Inn Tropical Casino for a week. This place could not have been better. It was clean, had a good restaurant and also a Fat Tuesdays Bar with great drinks. Casino was nice too. Felt very safe with large friendly staff and 24 hour security in the hotel and parking lot (you have to have a room key card to access the hotel floors which was nice). The area around the hotel was nice ( Home Depot, Super K, Applebees, just to name a few). Felt like being in the States. This was a perfect place to use as a base camp to visit the whole west coast of Puerto Rico. Its about a 30 minute drive either way to the northwest and southwest corner of the island. depending on the time its about a 2:20 minute drive from San Juan. Scenic drive not bad at all. Not knowing anything about Puerto Rico this place was perfect and I would definitely recommend it. After having been there and looking around for other potential places for future travels nothing came close to this hotel. It was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: VanInTexas
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel....have stayed twice on biz in the last couple of months for multiple nites. VERY clean (cleaner than the Intercontinental in San Juan), spacious rooms, responsive, friendly staff. There really is a rooster that crows in the morning which i found amusing, not annoying. Bath toiletries by Bath & Body Works. Ice and vending on every floor. No smoking in casino as mentioned in previous reviews. Nice pool area, guest laundry area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: scdv1130
Reviews.Content: I stood thier with the family for free i had some Priorty Points and used them , the service was great and the staff very helpfull , no problems at all great restaurants around area and the pepole of mayaguez very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant discovery”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel in Mayaguez when we were driving around Puerto Rico. We tried the Mayaguez Casino first and were shocked at the cost and the parking fees. We then went to the Holiday Inn and were pleasantly surprised at the price for a very pleasant room. The inhouse restaurant was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visiting western Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Berks1970
Reviews.Content: We didn't want to stay in one of the "funky" places in Rincon with all those dicey reviews out there, so we chose a Holiday Inn in Mayaguez. Boring, right? We figured this was a good choice since we also wanted to visit San German, the lighthouse at Cabo Rojo, and the beach at Boqueron, which are all south of the city. We chose well! We were delighted by the helpful staff. Ruben at the front desk was most helpful with telling us about interesting things to see and do in Mayaguez (we were impressed with all there was) and giving us a map and directions. They also know how to take care of their Platinum Priority Club members, offering us an upgrade to a suite and complementary breakfast. We had potential disaster one morning when we accidentally sent our car keys out with some clothes to be laundered. We had no idea we'd done that and were in quite a panicked state when the laundry service called the front desk to say they had the keys. It was very fortunate they called as promptly as they did, or else we might have had to contact the rental car company and pay $355. Karen from the front desk sent a member of the housekeeping staff out to retrieve our keys for us so we could be on our way. We really appreiated the professionalism of the staff. Other points: pools is very nice and was not at all crowded. Breakfast in the dining room is passable, esp. if it is free. The fitness room needs to be updated bigtime, but if all you want is a treadmill and some free weights, you'll be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wbru83
Reviews.Content: This week was my second stay in three months. The rooms were clean and the rooster in the parking lot outside my window was a nice touch. As a city boy, I thought the whole "cock-a-doodle doo" thing was a myth -- now I know it's not. The service staff was very nice...the desk staff will provide bottled water at no charge upon request. The restaurant is nothing special but there is an Applebee's about one mile north. And you can't be the $3 blackjack table. Not sure there would be any reason to stay here for vacation but it was fine for business.

Reviews.Title: “All I needed”
Reviews.Author: Alexis T
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel. Had everything I needed. The gym is small, but worked out to be just what I needed for my stay. The Casino is a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely the hotel's fault but I wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: alaskamtngirl
Reviews.Content: Location: right off the road/highway so you aren't going to get a view, I don't think from any part of the hotel. Smell: (Yes, I rate smells!) The casino had smoking and I'm allergic to smoke. You could smell it in other places too, but not really in the room. Food: I thought the food was pretty decent. Drinking? Go for Don Q and not Bacardi. You may get 2 for 1! :) But don't expect the poolside cabana fu-fu drinks. Just an ole' regular drink. Service: Wait staff and host in the restaurant - wonderful. They became my travel buddies. Casino staff - to be honest, no one in the casino seemed to be nice, or even particularly cordial to me. The locals they were nice to. When my friend showed up, they were nice to him. (I'm white - very white...translucent even, blonde/blue. He's white, but Puerto Rican - dark hair, light eyes, etc. My Spanish is on par with his and I can get by okay, certainly not same as a local, but enough to be courteous and beyond). Hotel gift shop: I could have made better gifts (and cheaper) in my room. Snacks? Hardly. I was relagated to the restaurant or bar. Pool: I think the pool probably was decent. I literally (not kidding here) had to walk past chickens and maybe a rooster to get to it. (And there was a headline in the paper about bird flu or some other bird sickness hitting PR so I was leary of birds). Then, I get to the pool. Sit in one of the chairs and lizards begin running over to me (I'm used to lizards in FL and other warmer climates). But there were a lot of them and some were fighting under me - maybe for a better shade spot, but try reading a book while lizards are fighting under you and chickens cluck behind you. So then I decide to go in the pool. I'm leary of public pools, but it's hot and I'm bored. I'll take a chance since only one person swimming. Like most swimmers (me included) the occasional wipe of the nose happens - I can handle this. But, then... the big pick of the nose and the ensuing quest for gold continued and I barely made it out of there before gagging. He deposited his treasures into the pool. So even that was ruined. No, that wasn't the hotel's fault. BUT... I later saw him working in the hotel. Hotel staff!!!! Room: The room was fine. I don't recall anything bad or particularly good about it. The views weren't great (or even good) but that was more based on location. I think you would stay here to do business in Mayaguez, not for the beauty of the island. The water bottle left in the room as complimentary had been opened and drank out of (could tell by the lipstick). And each day, they would take my unopened one and leave that one! But other than that, I think the room was fine. Nothing remarkable though. Adequate. My situation: which jaded me a bit, did allow me to fully partake in the hotel's amenities: I kept getting ditched by my travel partner (who took the car, my phone because forgot his and the laptop in case he needed it (directionally challenged). So I was basically stuck there. We weren't close enough to anything for me to walk. I could have taken the bus, but to where? And, without the phone was hard to look up. So was stuck at the hotel. And, walking anywhere would have been difficult for me. July - wicked hot. Walked around the zoo in Mayaguez and 2 minutes in was soaked completely with sweat because of humidity (locals & animals were too). Puerto Rico is beautiful. There is so much to see and do. Go with someone who wants to do this. (Similar happened in San Juan but we were close enough to all for me to book own excursions, walk around, catch the bus, etc. And... I finally switched hotels... he picked Marriott in the city, I picked the Marriott Stellaris on the beach... comparable price and mine was AMAZING).

Reviews.Title: “Casino/Restaurant Not Good”
Reviews.Author: TinaCara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did not stay here and thank goodness we didn't. We took a cab to the casino and decided to have a bite to eat in the hotel restaurant. All we ordered was a ceviche and meat and cheese appetizer. It took 20 minutes to get it and only because we asked for it. The server was horrible. The octopus in the ceviche was so hard to chew, it was terrible. The food is overpriced. We spent $30 on those 2 apps. We also had to ask for our check because the server was too busy doing sidework and the other employees chatting. Then we went to the bar to get 2 Malibu and pineapple juice. What was $7 everywhere else for the same 2 drinks was $18 at the Holiday Inn casino bar. The casino was small but okay. Our main issue was the high prices and terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “While not perfect, I would recommend this to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Budget_Traveler_007
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It was very clean, the lobby was nice, management was friendly/accommodating (gave me free waters and I don't even have any status with Holiday Inn). The location was right off of "2" - which is a good location - though not central to an city and it's not beach-side. Breakfast was not free, but not bad either. I didn't get a chance to go into the Casino, but it looked basic. I wouldn't recommend this for a romantic getaway (I wasn't that impressed with Mayaguez at all, actually) but it is close to Rincon and a great 1 or 2-night stopover if you are doing a "cross-country" trip through PR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Nice Staff, Will Return Every Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: jazi1105
Reviews.Content: After a horrid night in Joyuda, we found the Holiday Inn on our way home. I decided to stop and check out the prices at least so that we could at least enjoy one part of our honeymoon. We paid $139 something for the night and they let us check in when we arrived, which was at 11:00am, instead of waiting until 3:00pm!! We went to the pool, enjoyed it, even though the water was almost freezing, but it was refreshing considering how hot it was. The restaraunt was fairly priced, and very good. The waiters were friendly. That evening, we ordered a bottle of wine through room service, then later some food. We had a great view of the pool from the room, and to my surprise, they even offered a "pillow menu" where if you are not satisfied with the "medium pillows" that are pre-arranged on your bed, you can call the front desk and order any kind of pillow that meets your fancy at no extra cost. The water was hot, just as I wanted, which was a BIG change from the pervious hotel, and the room was in great condition. We definetly got our money's worth at the Holiday Inn, and my husband and I are planning to at least celebrate our first snniversary as a married couple there. This is a marvelous hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Accommodations, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: hi-desertraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn from Sun-Weds, and was very impressed and pleased with the accommodations, king-size bed with pillow-top mattress, and custom selected pillows. Large LCD TV and nice desk and over-stuffed recliner chair. Bathroom was large, with full counter and hair dryer. We booked thru Priority Club, and paid $108 a night, which included a very through Continental Breakfast on the 6th floor, juice, cold cereal, pastries, fruit, coffee, and a hot entre, ie., pancakes, wraps, and oatmeal. Very ample and pleasant room, with 2 large LCD TV,s and around 10 tables, with placemats, cloth napkins and china dishwear. The room was attended by a very delightful attendant, who was fluent in English, which is a bit rare in Puerto Rico. We had no noise problems with a 5th floor room, above the Casino. The Guest parking lot was above 100 feet away from the front entry, but it always had parking available, which wasn't the same with the rest of the parking lot. On our Sunday afternoon arrival, the regular parking lot was full, but not the guest lot, which was guarded by a chain, and a security guard. The pool was nice, the grounds very tropical, flowering bushes and trees and grass. The elevator required a room key to use, a great security feature, which was very reassuring!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: san3571
Reviews.Content: I was with my loved one and his first time out of the main land. After having a horrible experience with a hotel in san juan, I decided to go where I am comfortable (West Coast). Hotel made immediate accomedations for us, which was great. Hospitality was great, poolside very clean, breakfast complimentary, casino very pleasant. Convenient to airport; u must rent a vehicle if you want to experience the beaches and many tourist attractions. *****TOURIST ATTRACTIONS ARE NOT ONLY IN SAN JUAN*****

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn, but with better coffee!”
Reviews.Author: MyAdvice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not on the beach, although you can see the ocean from some of the rooms. The room I had was clean and the bed was comfortable. The restaurant food was also relatively inexpensive for a Holiday Inn. I canâ€™t comment much about the casino as I donâ€™t gamble, except to say that it looked like the casino was more of a hit with the locals than the hotel guests. I didnâ€™t use the pool so I canâ€™t comment on that. The wireless was free, but in my room it was fairly weak and would drop on occasion. The hotel represented a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sun&oil
Reviews.Content: While staying in Mayaguez, my parents decided to treat themselves to Christmas dinner at the restaurant attachted to the hotel. Their whole party (6) was extremely disappointed at the quality of the over priced meal.

Reviews.Title: “imjintscout”
Reviews.Author: imjinscout
Reviews.Content: just got back from the trip! i had no water in the bathroom, the pressure would go away !!! i went down to complain to the hotel manager. he said he will investigate. came back later that night . the problem was there again!!! i talk to another manager, he gave me another room with the same problem. also not enough towels.i will not stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “They held my Express mail package for 3 days!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was expecting an Express Mail package. For three days I asked the front desk if they received my package and the answer was, no package. We'll call you when it arrives. After tradking the package I discovered it was there for the past 3 days! Way to go guys. Sitting by the by the pool was great for about 30 minutes. Than the giant speakers came out and it sounded like I was at a block party just broke out. So much for reading the paper and relaxing by the pool.. Not everything was awful at the hotel. The brakfast was good and the coffee was great.

Reviews.Title: “Older crowd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were okay, but not for the price you pay. The pool and restaurants were nice. The view of mountain tops was a plus. The club closes at 2am, and nothing but 40+ dancing salsa. Casino was okay but thought it was too small. Never order a long island ice tea there. Stick with one liquor drinks. It is a relaxing place to stay but want to wait for a special.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to sleep”
Reviews.Author: DealsRock
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn needs to decide whether it is in the Entertainment or the Hospitality business. Our room was two floors above the discoteque and we could not sleep above the loud booming discoteque music that booms through the building. At the price I paid for our vacation, including airfare, I just wanted a good night's sleep. Instead, I received the nagging sound of booming bass music and had interrupted sleep from 9P-305A. This was 6 hours I wouldn't want anyone to go through.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Holiday Inn in Mayaquez was a wonderful experience. It felt like home. Rooms were excellent. Staff were friendly, food was wonderful, and entertainment was great. For those who love to dance, its available every weekend. Casino is open twenty four hours. The Mayaquez town is ten minutes from the hotel. If suba diving is your thing, the town of Rincon is fifteen or twenty minutes away. The historic town of San German where the oldest church known as Porta Coeli was built in 1606 is about forty five minutes from the hotel. Sea loving community is in Cabo Rojo is about thirty or forty minutes away, you'll find beach towns in La parquera, El Combate and boqueron. Experience the other side of the Island. It's possible if you stay at the Holiday Inn. I personally loved it.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Mayaquez & Tropical Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 2701 Hwy 2, Mayaguez 00680, Puerto Rico
